Class CCMPAgent

java.lang.Object
  testbed.agent.Agent
      agent.CCMPAgent
Direct Known Subclasses:
BayesWekaCCMPAgent, SimpleCCMPAgent
public abstract class CCMPAgent
extends testbed.agent.Agent

Abstract CCMP Agent.

Constructor Detail

CCMPAgent

public CCMPAgent()
Create the decision tree and trust network by calling the abstract function the specific type of CCMPAgent will then create their specific DT and TN

CCMPAgent

public CCMPAgent(java.lang.String paramFile)
Create the decision tree and trust network by calling the abstract function the specific type of CCMPAgent will then create their specific DT and TN Then parse the config file using the param file string.

Parameters:
paramFile -
Method Detail

initializeAgent

public void initializeAgent()
Initialize the CCMPAgent by setting up the logger (agentName_log.txt) Call init on the DT and TN, then add all the agents to the TN. Since you've initialized the TN with default values, you should pass this to the DT

Specified by:
initializeAgent in class testbed.agent.Agent
See Also:
Agent.initializeAgent()

prepareCertaintyReplies

public void prepareCertaintyReplies()
Parse the incoming certainty requests from other agents. Ask the DT if we should respond to these requests, if so generate the messages. The TN (and DT?) may want to know that we did this, therefore pass the info to it.

Specified by:
prepareCertaintyReplies in class testbed.agent.Agent
See Also:
Agent.prepareCertaintyReplies()

prepareCertaintyRequests

public void prepareCertaintyRequests()
Parse the incoming reputation replies, based on our requests to other agents. Determine if an agent didn't send a response, even after we paid them and update the TN/DT Update the TN with the new values. Pass those new values to the DT Generate the certainty request messages by going through all the era we have paintings in then for each agent, ask the DT is we should request a message from that agent.

Specified by:
prepareCertaintyRequests in class testbed.agent.Agent
See Also:
Agent.prepareCertaintyRequests()

prepareOpinionCreationOrders

public void prepareOpinionCreationOrders()
Parse the incoming request messages from the other agents. First determine if an agent didn't request an opinion, after we sent them our certainty, tell this to the TN (and DT?) and update the trust values. Then go through all the opinion requests and ask the DT whether we should generate an opinion creation messages. If we do create one, ask the DT how much we should spend on the creation order. Then tell the TN (and DT?) that we did or did not fulfill the opinion request.

Specified by:
prepareOpinionCreationOrders in class testbed.agent.Agent
See Also:
Agent.prepareOpinionCreationOrders()

prepareOpinionProviderWeights

public void prepareOpinionProviderWeights()
For each agent and era get the weight from the decision tree and generate a weight message to the sim.

Specified by:
prepareOpinionProviderWeights in class testbed.agent.Agent
See Also:
Agent.prepareOpinionProviderWeights()

prepareOpinionReplies

public void prepareOpinionReplies()
Go through the list of opinions we got back from the Sim and ask the DT how much we should adjust the value (if we want to be mean to people we don't like) Then generate a opinion reply message.

Specified by:
prepareOpinionReplies in class testbed.agent.Agent
See Also:
Agent.prepareOpinionReplies()

prepareOpinionRequests

public void prepareOpinionRequests()
Parse the incoming certainty reply messages, from our requests for certainties. Determine if an agent did not provide a certainty reply and tell the TN (and DT) Update the certainty values in the TN and DT and then the trust values. Go through all the paintings we were assigned and then for each agent ask the DT whether we should ask them for an opinion.

Specified by:
prepareOpinionRequests in class testbed.agent.Agent
See Also:
Agent.prepareOpinionRequests()

prepareReputationAcceptsAndDeclines

public void prepareReputationAcceptsAndDeclines()
Parse the incoming reputation request messages, from other Agents. Ask the DT whether we should response to the requesting agent, about another agent and era. Create the appropriate message and then tell the TN (and DT) that responded.

Specified by:
prepareReputationAcceptsAndDeclines in class testbed.agent.Agent
See Also:
Agent.prepareReputationAcceptsAndDeclines()

prepareReputationReplies

public void prepareReputationReplies()
Parse the incoming reputation requests accept/decline messages, coming from our requests for reputations. Determine if an agent didn't accept our request, and tell the TN (and DT) about it Then, go through the reputation accept/decline messages we generated in the last function and ask the DT whether we should actually generate a reputation.

Specified by:
prepareReputationReplies in class testbed.agent.Agent
See Also:
Agent.prepareReputationReplies()

prepareReputationRequests

public void prepareReputationRequests()
Process the results from the last frame (final appraisal values etc) Go through each era and agent and ask the DT whether we should ask for a reputation

Specified by:
prepareReputationRequests in class testbed.agent.Agent
See Also:
Agent.prepareReputationRequests()

updateDecisionTreeTrustValues

private void updateDecisionTreeTrustValues(java.lang.String toAgent,
                                           testbed.sim.Era era)
For the given agent and era, get the new trust and inferred trust from the TN and pass it to the DT.

findOpinion

private testbed.sim.Opinion findOpinion(java.lang.String _transactionID)
Use this method to sort through ordered opinions the sim delivers, by transactionID.

processFrameResults

private void processFrameResults()
Reset the DT and TN for the frame. Determine which eras we have paintings for in this frame Parse through the opinion reply messages we received for the last frame. Determine if an agent did not respond to us and tell the TN (and DT?) about the negative experience. Parse through the final appraisal values and pass the final appraisal and each agents opinion to the TN to update the trust values based on the experiences.
